messages.content: You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Suggest a session for second generation org-dependent packaging, with a title of max 80 characters and an abstract of max 200 characters

Title : Adopt Package-Based Development with Org-Dependent Packaging
Abstract: If you’ve been wanting to move to a more application-based development model, but have struggled to untangle the existing metadata, org dependent packaging is the solution you’ve been looking for.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Give me a session on prompt engineering, with a title of max 80 characters and an abstract of max 200 characters. Call out that the quality of the prompt correlates with the quality of the output.

Title: Design Prompts for Better Generative Outputs
Abstract: Generative AI outputs are only as strong and relevant as the prompt you give. Learn to enrich your prompts to maximize the utility of generated content.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
I need a session on the Einstein Trust Layer that refers to the on platform nature and mentions security and privacy

Title: Dig Deep into Data Privacy with the Einstein Trust Layer
Abstract: Salesforce's best-in-class security guardrails are natively embedded in Einstein. Learn how the Einstein Trust Layer addresses the data privacy challenges of generative AI.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Give me details for an entry level session on prompting generative AI

Title: Prompt Builder 101
Abstract: Take the guesswork out of AI with Prompt Builder. Learn how to build prompts to increase productivity and create trusted outputs.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Suggest a conference session on Lightning Web Components to showcase a timeline component

Title: Build a Timeline Component in LWC
Abstract: Learn how to build a complex LWC Timeline component. This session will take you from idea to prototype where you will leverage Salesforce Platform features to finally listing it on AppExchange.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Give me a title and abstract for a session on creating custom Copilot actions in Apex. Identify the hands on nature of the session and call out the takeaway of learning best practice.

Title: Build Custom Copilot Actions Using Apex
Abstract: Developers, learn how to use your skills to enhance Einstein Copilot with custom actions. You’ll learn best practices for building, describing, testing, and deploying Einstein Copilot Apex actions.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand

Come up with a proposal for a session on application lifecycle management adn teh role that devops plays in it. Identify that this will cover the general concepts and the Salesforce specific tools to facilitate.

Title: Get Started with Application Lifecycle Management and DevOps
Abstract: Learn why DevOps, application lifecycle management, and governance are vital to delivering apps efficiently and safely, and how the tools that Salesforce provides facilitate and enhance this process.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Give me details for a session on Apex error handling,calling out the benefits for building applications and investigating problems that crop up.

Title: Make More Resilient Apps with Advanced Apex Error Handling
Abstract: Learn how to use advanced Apex error handling techniques to build more resilient applications and make debugging a breeze.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Suggest a conference session on choosing between Apex triggers and record triggered flows. The attendees will understand best practices as they are applied to real-world examples.

Title: Record-Triggered Flows vs Apex Triggers: How to Decide?
Abstract: Understanding when to choose Flows versus Apex Triggers is critical for developers designing optimal solutions. Join us to explore best practices and use them in real business cases.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Give me a title and abstract for a conference session on the GraphQL wire adapter for LWC. Call out the benfits of easy data access and how that can be used for new application areas

Title: Deep Dive into the GraphQL Wire Adapter for LWC
Abstract: Supercharge your LWCs with GraphQL. Learn how the new GraphQL Wire Adapter simplifies your Salesforce data access to power new user experiences.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Give me a title and abstract for a conference session on platform events, calling out the benefits of event driven applications. Keep the title under 80 characters and the abstract under 200

Title: Build Scalable and Responsive Apps with Platform Events
Abstract: Learn how Trailblazers are using high-scale platform events to build responsive applications that ensure customer satisfaction.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Give me a title and abstract for a conference session explaining how customer data can be used to provide a highly personalised experience. Emphasize what attendees will get out of this session.

Title: Data-Driven Hyperpersonalization: Elevating Experiences
Abstract: Unleash the power of data for personalized experiences. Gain insights, best practices, and examples for customer-centric revolution. Stay ahead in this hyperpersonalization era.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Create details for a conference talk by Salesforce staff on the Einstein Trust Layer and how it allows generative AI to be used without endangering trust.

Title: Learn how Einstein Secures your Customer Data
Abstract: Join us as we discuss how the Einstein Trust Layer will securely provide Generative AI capabilities without any compromise to our #1 Value here at Salesforce - Trust.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand

Write the title and abstract for a talk on how important quality data is for generative AI. The data in this case will be provided by Salesforce's Data Cloud so mention any benefits of that in terms of quality, safety and ability to scale.

Title: The Importance of Data for Generative AI
Abstract: Discover how to use Data Cloud to unlock quality, trusted data, and safely bring billions of customer events to Einstein - generating content across every line of business.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Come up with a session on the use of generative AI in marketing, referencing the improvements in speed and personalisation and how this will impact customers.

Title: Put the Pedal to the Metal with Generative AI for Marketers
Abstract: Using trusted generative and predictive AI can supercharge marketing efforts. In this session, learn how to leverage AI tools to maximize your customer lifetime value with AI-powered personalization.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Write a title and abstract for a talk on Slack automation for beginners. This should appeal to people who want to use automation, but don't yet have the skills.

Title: Discover How Automation Can Transform Your Work with Slack
Abstract: You are convinced of the value of automation, now what? Join us to explore real-world use cases to jumpstart your automation journey with Slack.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Generate session details for a talk on the improvements to LWC development and reusability using mixins and apex abstractions.

Title: Enhance LWC Reusability with Mixins and Apex Abstractions
Abstract: Thanks to JavaScript Mixins and Apex abstractions, we were able to reduce LWC development times by more than 40%, and also time spent on bug fixing and testing. Join this session to know how.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Create a session on the benefits of using the Salesforce CLI. Include references to workflow, automation and pipelines, plus integrating with other development tools.

Title: Unleash the Potential of the Salesforce CLI: Advanced Topics
Abstract: Explore advanced features of the new Salesforce CLI. Discover how to supercharge workflows and enable complex automation. Learn to build advanced pipelines and integrate other development systems.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand

Create a session on using the GraphQL wire adapter to access data in lightning web components without server side apex. The title should be less than 100 characters and the abstract under 500. Keep the tone conversational.

Title: Bring data to your LWC without Apex using the GraphQL Wire Adapter
Abstract: Using Lightning Data Service is great in LWC, getting record data in just a few lines of code without having to write Apex, Test Class, be sure that Field Level Security is checked etc… But you quickly hit a limit, as soon as you want to get more specific data, applying filters or getting relationships, you need to go back to Apex. Not anymore! With the GraphQL Wire Adapter you’ll be able to query Salesforce data right from your LWC without writing a single line of Apex. Let’s have a look!
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand
Create a session on an introduction to Git for Salesforce Administrators. Make it clear that it is aimed at non-developers and what an attendee will learn.

Title: An Admin’s guide to Git
Abstract: An introduction to source control using Git for non-coders. Admins will learn the benefits of source control for all types of metadata and gain an introduction to Salesforce DevOps.
You are an expert on Salesforce who creates session ideas for conferences on demand

Generate a title and abstract for a conference talk on launching your first app on teh Salesforce App exchange. Call out that Salesforce recently passed 10 million installs, and that publishing an app might be easier than attendees think.

Title: AppExchange: What Does It Take to Publish Your First App?
Abstract: A few months ago, Salesforce celebrated 10 Million AppExchange Installs. Did you participate in this milestone only from an end-user perspective? Let’s change it! It’s the best moment to learn what it takes to build and publish an app. Maybe you are Salesforce Developer looking for a new way to master your technical skills or already a Solopreneur with a million-dollar idea? This session will show you that publishing your app on AppExchange is easier than you think!
